channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: DCIts -- Deep Convolutional Interpreter for time series
item.description: We introduce an interpretable deep learning model for multivariate time series forecasting that prioritizes both predictive performance and interpretability - key requirements for understanding complex physical phenomena.

item.title: AutoDFL: A Scalable and Automated Reputation-Aware Decentralized Federated Learning
item.description: Reputation-aware BFL poses even more challenges, as blockchain validators are tasked with processing federated learning transactions along with the transactions that evaluate FL tasks and aggregate reputations.

item.title: InfiGUIAgent: A Multimodal Generalist GUI Agent with Native Reasoning and Reflection
item.description: Graphical User Interface (GUI) Agents, powered by multimodal large language models (MLLMs), have shown great potential for task automation on computing devices such as computers and mobile phones.

item.title: Grokking at the Edge of Numerical Stability
item.description: To validate our hypotheses, we introduce two key contributions that address the challenges in grokking tasks: StableMax, a new activation function that prevents SC and enables grokking without regularization, and $\perp$Grad, a training algorithm that promotes quick generalization in grokking tasks by preventing NLM altogether.

item.title: LLM4SR: A Survey on Large Language Models for Scientific Research
item.description: In recent years, the rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) has transformed the landscape of scientific research, offering unprecedented support across various stages of the research cycle.

item.title: A Statistical Theory of Contrastive Pre-training and Multimodal Generative AI
item.description: Multi-modal generative AI systems, such as those combining vision and language, rely on contrastive pre-training to learn representations across different modalities.

item.title: Rethinking High-speed Image Reconstruction Framework with Spike Camera
item.description: Spike cameras, as innovative neuromorphic devices, generate continuous spike streams to capture high-speed scenes with lower bandwidth and higher dynamic range than traditional RGB cameras.

item.title: A Semantic Partitioning Method for Large-Scale Training of Knowledge Graph Embeddings
item.description: In recent years, knowledge graph embeddings have achieved great success.

item.title: DeFusion: An Effective Decoupling Fusion Network for Multi-Modal Pregnancy Prediction
item.description: Temporal embryo images and parental fertility table indicators are both valuable for pregnancy prediction in \textbf{in vitro fertilization embryo transfer} (IVF-ET).

item.title: RadGPT: Constructing 3D Image-Text Tumor Datasets
item.description: With over 85 million CT scans performed annually in the United States, creating tumor-related reports is a challenging and time-consuming task for radiologists.

item.title: A Histologic Dataset of Normal and Atypical Mitotic Figures on Human Breast Cancer (AMi-Br)
item.description: Assessment of the density of mitotic figures (MFs) in histologic tumor sections is an important prognostic marker for many tumor types, including breast cancer.

item.title: Rapid Automated Mapping of Clouds on Titan With Instance Segmentation
item.description: Despite widespread adoption of deep learning models to address a variety of computer vision tasks, planetary science has yet to see extensive utilization of such tools to address its unique problems.

item.title: DispFormer: Pretrained Transformer for Flexible Dispersion Curve Inversion from Global Synthesis to Regional Applications
item.description: Surface wave dispersion curve inversion is essential for estimating subsurface Shear-wave velocity ($v_s$), yet traditional methods often struggle to balance computational efficiency with inversion accuracy.

item.title: RSAR: Restricted State Angle Resolver and Rotated SAR Benchmark
item.description: Our approach can effectively improve the performance of existing state-of-the-art weakly supervised methods and even surpasses fully supervised models on existing optical benchmarks (i. e., DOTA-v1. 0 dataset).

item.title: Online Gaussian Test-Time Adaptation of Vision-Language Models
item.description: We demonstrate that OGA outperforms state-of-the-art methods on most datasets and runs.

item.title: Hidden Entity Detection from GitHub Leveraging Large Language Models
item.description: This paper follows this recent trend and investigates the potential of leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) in such scenarios to automatically detect datasets and software within textual content from GitHub repositories.

item.title: TimelineKGQA: A Comprehensive Question-Answer Pair Generator for Temporal Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Question answering over temporal knowledge graphs (TKGs) is crucial for understanding evolving facts and relationships, yet its development is hindered by limited datasets and difficulties in generating custom QA pairs.

item.title: Unified Coding for Both Human Perception and Generalized Machine Analytics with CLIP Supervision
item.description: The image compression model has long struggled with adaptability and generalization, as the decoded bitstream typically serves only human or machine needs and fails to preserve information for unseen visual tasks.

item.title: ContextMRI: Enhancing Compressed Sensing MRI through Metadata Conditioning
item.description: In this work, we propose ContextMRI, a text-conditioned diffusion model for MRI that integrates granular metadata into the reconstruction process.

item.title: Neural Parameter Estimation with Incomplete Data
item.description: Leveraging their computational speed and flexibility, neural networks are also being used to facilitate fast, likelihood-free statistical inference.

item.title: MB-TaylorFormer V2: Improved Multi-branch Linear Transformer Expanded by Taylor Formula for Image Restoration
item.description: This variant leverages the Taylor expansion to approximate the Softmax-attention and utilizes the concept of norm-preserving mapping to approximate the remainder of the first-order Taylor expansion, resulting in a linear computational complexity.

item.title: A Closer Look on Gender Stereotypes in Movie Recommender Systems and Their Implications with Privacy
item.description: In the second phase, four inference algorithms were applied to detect gender stereotypes by combining the findings from the first phase with users' feedback data.

item.title: Comprehensive Examination of Unrolled Networks for Linear Inverse Problems
item.description: Unrolled networks have become prevalent in various computer vision and imaging tasks.

item.title: Test-Time Optimization for Domain Adaptive Open Vocabulary Segmentation
item.description: We present Seg-TTO, a novel framework for zero-shot, open-vocabulary semantic segmentation (OVSS), designed to excel in specialized domain tasks.

item.title: Understanding Before Reasoning: Enhancing Chain-of-Thought with Iterative Summarization Pre-Prompting
item.description: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) Prompting is a dominant paradigm in Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance complex reasoning.

item.title: NSA: Neuro-symbolic ARC Challenge
item.description: The Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC) evaluates general reasoning capabilities that are difficult for both machine learning models and combinatorial search methods.

item.title: Combining YOLO and Visual Rhythm for Vehicle Counting
item.description: Video-based vehicle detection and counting play a critical role in managing transport infrastructure.

item.title: A Plug-and-Play Bregman ADMM Module for Inferring Event Branches in Temporal Point Processes
item.description: Specifically, we formulate the inference of event branches as an optimization problem for the event transition matrix under sparse and low-rank constraints, which is embedded in existing TPP models or their learning paradigms.

item.title: Are They the Same? Exploring Visual Correspondence Shortcomings of Multimodal LLMs
item.description: Recent advancements in multimodal models have shown a strong ability in visual perception, reasoning abilities, and vision-language understanding.

item.title: FedKD-hybrid: Federated Hybrid Knowledge Distillation for Lithography Hotspot Detection
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) provides novel solutions for machine learning (ML)-based lithography hotspot detection (LHD) under distributed privacy-preserving settings.

item.title: Cosmological Parameter Estimation with Sequential Linear Simulation-based Inference
item.description: We develop the framework of Linear Simulation-based Inference (LSBI), an application of simulation-based inference where the likelihood is approximated by a Gaussian linear function of its parameters.

item.title: Machine learning applications in archaeological practices: a review
item.description: This review highlights the importance of well-defined and well-reported structured methodologies and collaborative practices to maximise the potential of applications of machine learning methods in archaeology.

item.title: Exploring Molecule Generation Using Latent Space Graph Diffusion
item.description: Generating molecular graphs is a challenging task due to their discrete nature and the competitive objectives involved.

item.title: MHGNet: Multi-Heterogeneous Graph Neural Network for Traffic Prediction
item.description: In recent years, traffic flow prediction has played a crucial role in the management of intelligent transportation systems.

item.title: TexHOI: Reconstructing Textures of 3D Unknown Objects in Monocular Hand-Object Interaction Scenes
item.description: Reconstructing 3D models of dynamic, real-world objects with high-fidelity textures from monocular frame sequences has been a challenging problem in recent years.

item.title: FgC2F-UDiff: Frequency-guided and Coarse-to-fine Unified Diffusion Model for Multi-modality Missing MRI Synthesis
item.description: Multi-modality magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is essential for the diagnosis and treatment of brain tumors.

item.title: Salient Region Matching for Fully Automated MR-TRUS Registration
item.description: The registration of magnetic resonance (MR) and transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) can provide guidance for the targeted biopsy of prostate cancer.

item.title: LLaVA-Mini: Efficient Image and Video Large Multimodal Models with One Vision Token
item.description: To achieve a high compression ratio of vision tokens while preserving visual information, we first analyze how LMMs understand vision tokens and find that most vision tokens only play a crucial role in the early layers of LLM backbone, where they mainly fuse visual information into text tokens.

item.title: Unsupervised Speech Segmentation: A General Approach Using Speech Language Models
item.description: Unlike traditional speech and audio segmentation, which mainly focuses on spectral changes in the input signal, e. g., phone segmentation, our approach tries to segment the spoken utterance into chunks with differing acoustic-semantic styles, focusing on acoustic-semantic information that does not translate well into text, e. g., emotion or speaker.

item.title: Stochastic Process Learning via Operator Flow Matching
item.description: Expanding on neural operators, we propose a novel framework for stochastic process learning across arbitrary domains.

item.title: Cosmos World Foundation Model Platform for Physical AI
item.description: We position a world foundation model as a general-purpose world model that can be fine-tuned into customized world models for downstream applications.

item.title: Temporal Feature Weaving for Neonatal Echocardiographic Viewpoint Video Classification
item.description: Automated viewpoint classification in echocardiograms can help under-resourced clinics and hospitals in providing faster diagnosis and screening when expert technicians may not be available.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Accuracy-Robustness Tradeoff and Training Efficiency in Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: CF-AMC-SSL demonstrates the effectiveness of free adversarial training in reducing training time while simultaneously improving clean accuracy and adversarial robustness.

item.title: Radar Signal Recognition through Self-Supervised Learning and Domain Adaptation
item.description: Specifically, we investigate pre-training masked autoencoders (MAE) on baseband in-phase and quadrature (I/Q) signals from various RF domains and subsequently transfer the learned representation to the radar domain, where annotated data are limited.

item.title: Strip R-CNN: Large Strip Convolution for Remote Sensing Object Detection
item.description: While witnessed with rapid development, remote sensing object detection remains challenging for detecting high aspect ratio objects.

item.title: Magic Mirror: ID-Preserved Video Generation in Video Diffusion Transformers
item.description: We present Magic Mirror, a framework for generating identity-preserved videos with cinematic-level quality and dynamic motion.

item.title: Image Segmentation: Inducing graph-based learning
item.description: This study explores the potential of graph neural networks (GNNs) to enhance semantic segmentation across diverse image modalities.

item.title: A Diversity-Enhanced Knowledge Distillation Model for Practical Math Word Problem Solving
item.description: Our approach proposes an adaptive diversity distillation method, in which a student model learns diverse equations by selectively transferring high-quality knowledge from a teacher model.

item.title: Multi-armed Bandit and Backbone boost Lin-Kernighan-Helsgaun Algorithm for the Traveling Salesman Problems
item.description: We apply our methods to LKH and LKH-3, which is an extension version of LKH that can be used to solve about 40 variant problems of TSP and Vehicle Routing Problem (VRP).

item.title: MM-GEN: Enhancing Task Performance Through Targeted Multimodal Data Curation
item.description: Vision-language models (VLMs) are highly effective but often underperform on specialized tasks; for example, Llava-1. 5 struggles with chart and diagram understanding due to scarce task-specific training data.
